Uh, this Blake Lively movie looks pretty
darn good. I'm as surprised as the next
person. Wow. This just goes to show what
handsome production values can do for a
movie. But you know what? That's not
fair to Blake Lively, who looks like
she's doing a pretty darn good job here.
Also, I think she's perfectly cast as
someone who has some uh things done to
them rather than does things to other
people. Very interesting uh
differentiation between actually men and
women. I think I've mentioned this
before. There's a fascinating essay I
read uh a while back about how women are
judged by what can be done to them while
men are judged by what they can do for
you or to you. And I thought that was a
very interesting uh differentiation
between the two genders. But I think
Blake Lively is like um the perfect
doll, I guess you could say. And I think
that she's very well matched with the
role here. I I also like the way that
it's just put together. I think that the
idea of like the New Year's the New
Year's um you know, blowing the uh the
horn and the confetti at the table. It
even actually gave me like vibes from
The Shining, you know, that famous shot
of Jack Nicholson, of course, stuck in
the photo. Was he really there? Uh, it
just really captures your imagination
and I think that's what this trailer
does. It really captures your
imagination and it's a beautifully
edited trailer as well. And I think they
hit all the right points about making
you excited for the movie. I love when
they say it was almost magical because
it kind of uh ends up being a curse. And
I think the explanation as to why you
wouldn't like you know being immortal I
thought was very effective. you know
what is love but heartbreak when you
can't grow old with that person because
they always end up just you know leaving
you just by the passage of time being
separated from you. I thought that was a
very compelling idea. Uh very very very
very impressive trailer. I loved it so
much. And you know what else I was
really impressed with this. I wrote his
name down because this is like um one of
his first roles. Anthony and Gruber
makes a really good young Harrison Ford.
Don't you think? I'm impressed. If I
were if I were Kathleen Kennedy over at
uh Lucasfilm, now owned by Disney, and I
was thinking of that Han Solo spin-off
movie, maybe a prequel, I'd be like,
"What's that guy's agent's number?"
Because uh that is the most impressive
match to Harrison Ford I've seen yet.
But this looks very good. We'll have to
see when the actual movie comes out if
Blake Lively can carry all the emotional
uh ups and downs of this kind of role.
uh she is pretty one note as an actress,
but I think she has a very good look and
she's very good at knowing her angles
like like a model and I think that's why

why she's used quite a bit in ad

and very likable makes the character
very likable. So I'm curious, are you as
impressed with this trailer as I am? Do
you think Blake Lively can pull it off?
And what do you think of this Anthony

Write your thoughts down below. Thank
